game

Class OrbitGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • game.OrbitGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class OrbitGame
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    This class is the main game engine. It is the panel that contains the game as well as keeping track of game data and updates.
    Author:
    JustinDowty, Ted Lang, Alec Allain
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • OrbitGame

        public OrbitGame(int windowWidth,
                 int windowHeight,
                 int margin,
                 BlastTypes blastType)
        Constructor resets game, generates stars for background, and sets size and background of panel.
        Parameters:
        windowWidth - The window width for the game.
        windowHeight - The window height for the game.
        margin - The window margin to left of game.
        blastType - The players current blast type.

        Parameters:
        blastType - The players current blastType.

      • update

        public void update(int currTime,
                   ScorePanel scorePanel)
        Updates game, adding and resetting components at the appropriate times. Checks for game interactions via currentKey and checks for objects interacting.
        Parameters:
        currTime - Current time in game.
        scorePanel - Scorepanel to be updated.

      • checkIfShipHit

        public boolean checkIfShipHit(Meteor meteor)
        Calculates if ship is hit, calls methods to update game accordingly.
        Parameters:
        meteor - Meteor being checked for interaction.
        Returns:
        Whether or not ship has been hit.

      • getPlaying

        public boolean getPlaying()
        Returns:
        Whether game is being played currently.

      • changeFireButtonColor

        public void changeFireButtonColor()
        Changes the color of score panel if ship is firing. Color changes to gray if blast is active (meaning ship cannot fire yet) and to red if ship is ready to blast.
